title.narrative: Jordan Valley Centers Jofeh + Kreimeh - HLID 2015 (2015/15 School Year)

description.narrative: Conduct awareness sessions for community members near both Jofeh and Kreimeh centers.,Conduct training courses for 7 new and 16 returning volunteers and workers at both Jofeh and Kreimeh centers,Conduct CBR volunteer training courses for 13 volunteers and workers at both Jofeh and Kreimeh centers,Conduct home visits to families with individuals with disabilities in communities near both Jofeh and Kreimeh centers,Integrate 27 children and young people in Jofeh area public schools,Integrate 16 children and young people in Kreimeh area public schools,Conduct vocational training workshops for 7 young people with disabilities, and 2 higher-quality trainings for 15 youth at Jofeh center.,Provide rehabilitation and education services for 80 individuals with disabilities, i.e., 31 intellectually challenged children and young people, 27 hearing impaired children and young people, 8 visually impaired children and young people, and 14 physically challenged children and young people,Provide wheelchairs and/or other mobility assistance devices to an estimated 25 children and young people,Conduct hearing and visual tests and supply or repair devices for an estimated 118 individuals

In 2015, both of HLID's centers, Jofeh and Kreimeh, will continue to provide quality cross-disability services for over 570 individuals with impairments, including those who are hearing impaired, visually impaired, physically impaired and/or intellectually challenged as well as their family members. These services include the lending and distribution of equipment and learning devices, physiotherapy, audiological testing, hearing aids, hearing aid repair/maintenance and ear molds, as well as eye tests and eye glasses. In addition to rehabilitation services, the Jofeh center will also continue to offer vocational training and employment programs to provide professional skills training and job identification service to 22 young men and women with disabilities. Besides the improvement of their professional and social status, training also enables these youth to play a role in policy development, decision-making and administration.
